website_summaries.verdict: Despite its flimsy looks, the Scosche Lobedope SHP451M delivers full, rich bass with crisp highs and is a standout budget headphone pair.
pros: Deep bass response for size and price
Full-bodied quality audio performance at moderate to high volumes
Inline remote control and microphone for mobile devices
cons: Distorts at top volumes on deep bass tracks

customer_reviews.title: Solid Headphone for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, much better than you'd expect for such a bargain. However they can become uncomfortable after listening for a decent period of time (1-2 hours) as the earpieces rest on your ears rather than around them. Also because of the design, it won't be blocking out much outside noise as sound cancelling is not one of it's strengths. If you're looking for deep, rich sound that you can listen to for hours on end, look elsewhere and dish out the extra cash for a better pair. However if you're looking for quality sound from quality headphones at an unbeatable price, look no further as you won't find better headphones at this price.
customer_reviews.author: gamer4246

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: The bass is satisfying without being too much. The midrange is buttery smooth. The highs sound good without being too sharp. Never caused listening fatigue on extended use for hours. The cans don't swivel but they are quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: madden2012

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I use these everyday for 12+ hours. I use them at the office and in the car. They are perfect for blocking some sound, but not all, so I can still hear people walking into my cubicle and cars on the road.I find them very comfertable.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: $25 and Lasted for 9+ Months; The King of Cost Efficiency
customer_reviews.text: Most cost effective headphones I will likely ever buy. Sound quality isn't bad bust most importantly the cable has lasted me 9 months and counting. That's really the ultimate praise for a cheap pair of headphones, as I've grown extremely bitter with all of my $60+ headphone purchases shorting out in less than 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: They're fine headphones for the price, but contrary to other reviews I did not find the brand to be at all on par with more expensive brands. A fair deal, but hardly a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: The fit is nice and I like the slightly longer cord
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special in terms of sound quality. The fit is nice and I like the slightly longer cord.
customer_reviews.author: WPM

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these headphones. Unfortunately, only one side had consistent sound for me. Most of the time there was no sound at all coming from the left headphone. The two times the left side actually worked, it had about half the sound level of the right side. As others have said, the tightness of the band was a bit uncomfortable. I only had the product for one day, so I'm not sure if that would have improved with time. Since it was shipped directly from Amazon, return and refund was easy as pie.
customer_reviews.author: J. Worm

customer_reviews.title: Can Be Used As A Webcam Headset & Has Cloth Earphone Covers That Don't Flake With Heavy Use
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are good value. Short connection cable so I have to buy a coiled 6 foot extension. It has cloth covered over-the-ear headphones instead of black foam that flakes off with heavy use. Comparison with other more expensive earphones gives an equivalent sound spectrum along with the boosted bass response. It has a mic in the connection cable, so its suitable for webcam use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: seems a little bit flimsy in construction. Sound is very acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for the price. The only drawback is that the plastic band will stretch out very quickly, causing a loose fit. After 2 weeks the headphones were considerably looser.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Krzeminski

customer_reviews.title: really good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Loved these for my teenage brother who is very music/audio oriented. They are a good bang for the buck and arent big and clunky.
customer_reviews.author: woman about town

customer_reviews.title: Scosche SHP451M headphone
customer_reviews.text: I do love this Scosche headphone. I do have other phones the ear bud, for which I find them to be very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Opal

customer_reviews.title: Get them if you like deep bass!
customer_reviews.text: Not the most comfortable earphones, can't wear them longer than 1-2 hours. However, the sound quality is really good. Bass is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Stanislav Merezhko

customer_reviews.title: Looks are deceiving -- these sound great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after reading strong reviews in notable electronics magazines and they lived up to their praise. I was shocked at the sound quality coming out of these things. They sound great with a respectable amount of bass! They're not flashy, but they do look good even if they feel a little cheap. They're sturdier than I expected for this price and comfortable. If you just want your music to sound really good, without the unnecessary showiness of overlarge and highly branded headests, these really are great for such a bargain price.
customer_reviews.author: Tall Girl

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE (almost 5 years later...)
customer_reviews.text: As an update to my original review (below): almost 5 years later and these have remained fantastic. They have been bashed around,dropped, use at a loud volume, been to humid and dry climates....the quality is still wonderful. The sound hasn't deteriorated a single bit, and nothing has worn or broken. I am seriously impressed! The tightness I reported previously went away and is no longer a problem. From 2014: Pretty tight on my head and ear pieces don't swivel so they crush my ears after a while. But the sound is great and there is good cushioning on the ear pieces.
customer_reviews.author: R6

customer_reviews.title: They sounded pretty good, but they were fairly tight on my ...
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought these were a 3-star product. They sounded pretty good, but they were fairly tight on my head even after adjusting them several times. The cable isn't very long which is annoying. Then 40 days after I bought them, left ear went out and Amazon said no replacement because it was past 30 days. I am sad, now they are trash. :'(
customer_reviews.author: GeoffReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price but no more.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is not cheap junk but neither is it fantastic quality either. Light, flexible and very bright colored. They do NOT grip your head tightly nor can they be made to. The sound: Bright, slightly tinny. Fairly good bass but don't turn it up too high. Treb down two and bass up two. You get what you pay for in this case.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Fit hurts my ears
customer_reviews.text: They sound fine, but I should have gotten the kind that surround your ear. I don't like the pressure directly on my ear.
customer_reviews.author: Unique Name

customer_reviews.title: Run a bit small
customer_reviews.text: Sound is fine but the headphones run a bit small and were very tight on my head causing a headache after around 15 minutes of use.
customer_reviews.author: Michaella

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: only for pc or lap.do not ever try on hq stuff..
customer_reviews.author: Doris Yucel

customer_reviews.title: good sound but broken size adjuster
customer_reviews.text: The size adjustment band on the right side was broken so it would slide up and down instead of clicking and not hold its position. Sound was good for the price. Sucks that I can't really wear it because it slips down my ear...
customer_reviews.author: Busy Student

customer_reviews.title: Great set of headphones and mic
customer_reviews.text: Work great, I drive a truck it cut down the noise and now it works very well. It works as described
customer_reviews.author: Magella Belanger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great. The adjusting piece slips sometimes. My only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: dkamm

customer_reviews.title: These were very uncomfortable headphones. Biddeal does not offer ...
customer_reviews.text: These were very uncomfortable headphones. Biddeal does not offer refund if package is opened, so once you realize how uncomfortable they are you will be stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki R.

customer_reviews.title: Loud and good
customer_reviews.text: Being slightly deaf my single criterion was picking a headphone that plays loudly so I can listen without hearing aids on. And this one fits the bill very nicely- loud, clear and with good treble (useful because the iOS and Android IT Gods don't let you tweak podcast sound). Great bass with your music, too, only the way the phones fit on the ears is awkward (leaving gap). No impedance or sensitivity data is supplied. Answering phone calls works fine, too.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Hooft

product_meta.title: SCOSCHE lobeDOPE On-Ear Headphones with Remote and Mic (Blue)
feature_bullets: lobeDOPE headphones are designed to deliver thumping bass, crisp highs and are lightweight for extended listening comfort.
Lightweight polymer construction ensures lobeDOPE headphones are comfortable for extended listening.
The sound pumping from powerful 40mm drivers will remind you why you fell in love with music in the first place.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars39 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
